result.execSummary:
The defendant Jean M Ericksen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  Inform treatment providers of probation and charges.

To avoid any person or place associated with the sale distribution, or use of illegal controlled substances.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Straight time, STAYED, for use at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jean M Ericksen in court.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Court passes matter to allow defendant to complete the petition for appointment of counsel.  Case recalled at 9:50.  Court reviews and approves defendant's petition for appointment of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with co defendants victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Jean M Ericksen in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.    Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
